columns.ID: A unique identifier for each grape entry in the table.
columns.Grape: The name of the grape variety.
columns.Color: The color classification of the grape, indicating whether it is red or white.

grapes.table_description: The grapes table contains information about various grape varieties used in winemaking, including their unique IDs, names, and color classifications.

columns.No: A unique identifier assigned to each appellation.
columns.Appelation: The name of the wine-growing region or designated area.
columns.County: The county in which the appellation is located.
columns.State: The state in which the appellation is found, which is consistently California.
columns.Area: The broader geographical area classification of the appellation.
columns.isAVA: A designation indicating whether the appellation is an American Viticultural Area (AVA).

appellations.table_description: The 'appellations' table provides detailed information about various wine-growing regions, including their unique identifiers and classifications, along with their geographical locations and designations within the state of California.

columns.No: A unique identifier for each wine entry in the table.
columns.Grape: The type of grape used to produce the wine.
columns.Winery: The name of the winery that produced the wine.
columns.Appelation: The specific region or area where the wine is produced.
columns.State: The state in which the winery is located.
columns.Name: The name of the wine, often reflecting its brand or specific label.
columns.Year: The year in which the wine was produced.
columns.Price: The retail price of the wine.
columns.Score: A numerical rating that reflects the quality of the wine, typically based on expert reviews.
columns.Cases: The number of cases available for sale or produced.
columns.Drink: Recommended drinking windows or the optimal time range for consuming the wine.

wine.table_description: The wine table provides comprehensive information about various wines, including their identification, characteristics, origins, pricing, and quality assessments.
